IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: WE ARE THE PREMIER CHILDRENS MENTAL HEALTH AGENCY THAT REDUCES THE SUFFERING EXPERIENCED BY CHILDREN WHO HAVE EMOTIONAL PROBLEMS RELATED TO DEPRESSION, ANXIETY, AND BEHAVIOR LIKE ADHD. UNTREATED, THESE PROBLEMS CAN LEAD TO FAILURE IN SCHOOL, DRUGS, DELINQUENCY, AND SUICIDE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WE ARE THE PREMIER CHILDRENS MENTAL HEALTH AGENCY THAT REDUCES THE SUFFERING EXPERIENCED BY CHILDREN WHO HAVE EMOTIONAL PROBLEMS RELATED TO DEPRESSION, ANXIETY, AND BEHAVIOR LIKE ADHD. UNTREATED, THESE PROBLEMS CAN LEAD TO FAILURE IN SCHOOL, DRUGS, DELINQUENCY, AND SUICIDE.
IRS990.Desc: YOUTH SERVICES PROGRAM - WE PROVIDED 35,080 SESSIONS OF CLINICAL SERVICES INCLUDING COUNSELING, CASE MANAGEMENT, PSYCHIATRY, AND COMMUNITY AWARENESS TO 1875 CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES. THIS PROGRAM HELPS CHILDREN BETWEEN THE AGES OF FOUR AND THIRTEEN NAVIGATE THE DEVELOPMENTAL TASKS OF MIDDLE CHILDHOOD.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: TRANSITIONAL PROGRAM - WE PROVIDED 11,905 SESSIONS OF CLINICAL SERVICES INCLUDING COUNSELING, CASE MANAGEMENT, PSYCHIATRY, AND COMMUNITY AWARENESS TO 881 YOUTH AND THEIR FAMILIES. THIS PROGRAM ENGAGES CLIENTS BETWEEN THE AGES OF FOURTEEN THROUGH TWENTY-FOUR IN SERVICES TO FACILITATE RECOVERY, MAXIMIZE THEIR POTENTIAL TO ACHIEVE SUCCESS IN HOME, SCHOOL, AND COMMUNITY, AND SUCCESSFULLY TRANSITION TO INDEPENDENCE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: TRAUMA INFORMED DAY TREATMENT PROGRAM - WE PROVIDED 4,163 SESSIONS OF CLINICAL SERVICES INCLUDING COUNSELING, CASE MANAGEMENT, PSYCHIATRY, AND COMMUNITY AWARENESS TO 53 CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES. THIS IS AN INTENSIVE MENTAL HEALTH AND PSYCHOEDUCATION PROGRAM FOR CLIENTS BETWEEN THE AGES OF FIVE TO EIGHTEEN. CLIENTS LEARN NEW SKILLS SO THEY CAN SUCCESSFULLY TRANSITION TO A LESS RESTRICTIVE EDUCATIONAL SETTING.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: OTHER PROGRAMS INCLUDE CARE PATHWAY, SEXUAL INAPPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR REMEDIATION (SIBR), SCHOOL BASED CONSULTATION, EARLY CHILDHOOD PREVENTION, GEMINI, MST, & BH PREVENTION PROGRAM. THESE PROGRAMS HELP PREVENT SUICIDE, DRUG ABUSE, SEXUALLY INAPPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR, AND ASSIST CHILDREN AND YOUTH TO RECOVER FROM TRAUMA AND GO ON TO BECOME SUCCESSFUL ADULTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO PROVIDE A PERMANENT SOURCE OF INCOME

THE ORGANIZATIOIN IS A NONPROFIT ENTITY AND HAS BEEN GRANTED AN EXEMPTION FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). THE ORGANIZATION DETERMINED THAT IT IS NOT REQUIRED TO RECORD A LIABILITY RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.
EXPENSES NETTED WITH FUNDRAISING EVENT INCOME 130,723.
EXPENSES NETTED WITH FUNDRAISING EVENT INCOME 130,723.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED WITH THE PREPARER. DRAFT COPIES ARE SENT OUT TO OUR OPERATIONS COMMITTEE; AS WELL AS, THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF OUR BOARD FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. FINAL COPIES ARE GIVEN TO THE FULL BOARD AT THE NEXT BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY SHALL APPLY TO ALL DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES AND INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS PROVIDING SERVICES AND MATERIALS TO THE CORPORATION. WHEN ANY PERSON TO WHOM THIS POLICY APPLIES BELIEVES THAT HE OR SHE OR A MEMBER OF HIS OR HER IMMEDIATE FAMILY MIGHT HAVE OR DOES HAVE A REAL OR APPARENT CONFLICT, SUCH INDIVIDUAL SHOULD, IN ADDITION TO FILING THE DISCLOSURE NOTICE REQUIRED HEREUNDER, ABSTAIN FROM MAKING MOTIONS, VOTING, EXECUTING AGREEMENTS, OR TAKING ANY OTHER SIMILAR DIRECT ACTION ON BEHALF OF THE CORPORATION WHERE THE CONFLICT MIGHT PERTAIN, BUT SHALL NOT BE PRECLUDED FROM DEBATE OR OTHER SIMILAR INVOLVEMENT ON BEHALF OF THE CORPORATION. THE BOARD MAY, UPON RECEIPT OF A WRITTEN REQUEST, OR UPON ITS OWN INITIATIVE, ESTABLISH FURTHER GUIDELINES CONSISTENT WITH THE INTEREST OF THE CORPORATION FOR THE RESOLUTION OF ANY REAL OR APPARENT CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR CEO IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF OUR BOARD ANNUALLY. REVIEW INCLUDES SALARY COMPARISON OF LIKE AGENCIES IN OHIO VIA THE OHIO COUNCIL OF BEHAVIORAL HEALTHCARE PROVIDES SALARY AND COMPENSATION SURVEY. SALARY RANGES ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD IN THE SAME WAY FOR ALL POSITIONS. THIS PROCESS WAS COMPLETED IN 2022 FOR BOTH THE CEO; AS WELL AS, THE OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
